intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. appropinquans, commonly known as the yellow buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It features striking, bright yellow flowers with five broadly ovate petals and a distinctive, hairy central stigma. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with simple, trifoliate, and palmately compound leaves. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, and it prefers moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. The species is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
